Class CashierGUI

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
CashierGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public class CashierGUI extends JFrame
CashierGUI represents the graphical user interface for the cashier system.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • CashierGUI

      public CashierGUI()
      Constructs the CashierGUI frame and initializes the UI components. Establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database.

  • Method Details

    • searchDrink

      private void searchDrink(String searchText)
      Searches for a drink in the database by name.
      Parameters:
      searchText - The name of the drink to search for.

    • connectDatabase

      private void connectDatabase()
      Establishes a connection to the PostgreSQL database. If the connection fails, an error message is displayed.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while connecting to the database.

    • loadCategories

      private void loadCategories(JPanel categoriesPanel)
      Loads item categories from the database and creates buttons for each category.
      Parameters:
      categoriesPanel - The panel where category buttons will be displayed.
      Throws:
      SQLException - If an error occurs while querying the database.

    • loadItems

      private void loadItems(int categoryId)
      Loads items from a selected category and updates the items panel.
      Parameters:
      categoryId - The ID of the selected category.

    • showModificationDialog

      private int showModificationDialog(String title, int minId, int maxId)
      Displays a dialog for selecting a modification from the database.
      Parameters:
      title - The title text to display in the dialog
      minId - The minimum ID value (inclusive) to include in the query range
      maxId - The maximum ID value (inclusive) to include in the query range
      Returns:
      The ID of the selected modification, or minId if an error occurs
      Throws:
      SQLException - If a database access error occurs

    • getModificationName

      private String getModificationName(int id)
      Retrieves the name of a modification from the database by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the modification to retrieve
      Returns:
      The name of the modification, or "Unknown" if not found or if an error occurs

    • addItemToSummary

      private void addItemToSummary(CashierGUI.Item item)
      Adds an item to the order summary with user-selected modifications and toppings. This method handles the complete process of: 1. Prompting the user to select ice and sugar levels 2. Allowing the user to select toppings 3. Updating the item with selected modifications and toppings 4. Adding the item to the order 5. Updating the subtotal with item price and topping costs 6. Creating and adding the visual representation of the item to the UI 7. Adding a remove button to allow item deletion
      Parameters:
      item - The Item object to be added to the order summary

    • removeItemFromSummary

      private void removeItemFromSummary(CashierGUI.Item item, JPanel itemPanel)
      Removes an item from the order summary and updates the UI.
      Parameters:
      item - The Item object to be removed from the order
      itemPanel - The JPanel representing the item in the UI that should be removed

    • showToppingSelector

      private ArrayList<Integer> showToppingSelector()
      Displays a dialog allowing the user to select multiple toppings from the database. The dialog presents a grid of buttons for each available topping that can be toggled on/off. Selected toppings are visually highlighted with a green border.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Integer IDs representing the selected toppings

    • getToppingNames

      private String getToppingNames(ArrayList<Integer> toppingIds)
      Retrieves the names of toppings from the database based on their IDs.
      Parameters:
      toppingIds - An ArrayList of Integer IDs representing the toppings to look up
      Returns:
      A comma-separated String containing the names of all found toppings

    • updateInventory

      private void updateInventory()
      Updates the inventory quantities after an order is processed. For each item in the order, this method: 1. Decrements inventory for ingredients used in the drink 2. Decrements inventory for ingredients used in each topping Note: This method assumes each drink or topping uses 1 unit of each linked inventory item.

    • updateSummary

      private void updateSummary()
      Updates the order summary display with current pricing information. Calculates tax (8% of subtotal), total price, and updates the corresponding UI labels.

    • processCheckout

      private void processCheckout()

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point for the application. Creates and initializes a new CashierGUI instance.
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments (not used)
